The Elder Ekavihāri’s Birth Story
“In this auspicious aeon,
the kinsman of Brahmā, of great fame,🔽the best of speakers, arose with the name of Kassapa,
in the clan.
Free from the proliferation of things, without support,
with a mind like space,
he was one who abounded in emptiness,
delighting in the signless, in control.
With a mind free from attachment and defilements,
not associating with families or groups,
the great compassionate hero,🔽skilled in the means of discipline,
diligent in the affairs of others,

analyzed: vinayantaḥ sa devake  nibbāna gamanam magga  gatim paṅka visosana
translated: disciplining even the gods,🔽the path leading to Nibbāna,🔽the destination that cleanses the mire,🔽the deathless, the supreme bliss,
the prevention of old age and death,
in the midst of a great assembly,
sat the world’s protector.
The lord with the cry of the partridge,
the Brahmā-voiced Tathāgata,
lifting up from the great abyss,
the lost ones without a guide,
teaching the dust-free Dhamma,
I saw the world’s leader.
Having heard his Dhamma,
I went forth into homelessness.
Having gone forth then,
reflecting on the Jina’s teaching,
Alone I dwelt in a delightful forest,

analyzed: vasim sa sagga pīḍitaḥ  sakkāya vūpakāsaḥ me  hetu bhūtaḥ mama abhavī
translated: Free from the pain of association.🔽The appearance of the body was my cause,
I saw the danger in association with the mind’s appearance.
My defilements were burned up by me,
all my existences were destroyed;
Like an elephant who has broken his bonds,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed was it to me
to come into the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations as well,
The six super-knowledges have been realized,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Ekavihārika recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ekavihāriko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ekavihārikattherassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
